benchmark_details.name: UnLOK-VQA (Unlearning Outside Knowledge VQA)
benchmark_details.overview: UnLOK-VQA is a benchmark specifically designed for evaluating the targeted erasure of pretrained multimodal information from Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs). It involves high-quality, well-annotated image-text pairs to assess the effectiveness of unlearning methods against adversarial attacks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate a comprehensive evaluation of unlearning in Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) and serve as a challenging benchmark for future research in unlearning.

data.source: Automated generation and manual filtering using the OK-VQA dataset.
data.annotation: Manual filtering by human evaluators to retain high-quality samples.

methods: Experimental evaluation against whitebox and blackbox attacks
methodology.calculation: Attack success rates represent the percentage of successful extractions by the adversarial attacks during evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Lower attack success rates and higher rewrite scores indicate better performance of the unlearning methods.
methodology.validation: Manual filtering to ensure dataset quality through human evaluation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Our work aims to mitigate risks related to sensitive information leakage from MLLMs.
